item.title: Unique, a Swiss AI platform for finance, raises $30M
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
A four-year-old Swiss startup has raised a sizable chunk of change to capitalize on the burgeoning “agentic AI” movement. Unique said on Thursday that it has raised $30 million in a Series A funding round that was led by London-based VC firm DN Capital and CommerzVentures, the investment offshoot of Germany’s Commerzbank. “Agentic AI” is […]

item.title: Taktile helps fintechs build automated decision-making workflows
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The automated logic behind many financial decisions — for example, decisions that determine whether a client is approved for a credit line — is hard-coded. Often, it’s not easily changed. If a head of credit at a bank wanted to adjust the bank’s lending criteria, for example, they’d likely have to raise a ticket with […]

item.title: Instagram may spin off Reels into a separate app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Meta is mulling launching a standalone app for short-form videos, The Information reported, citing an anonymous source who heard Instagram head Adam Mosseri talking about the project to staff. The project is reportedly code-named Project Ray that aims to improve recommendations for new users and existing users in the U.S., and feature more three-minute videos, […]

item.title: Google Gemini: Everything you need to know about the generative AI models
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Gemini is Google’s long-promised, next-gen generative AI model family.

item.title: Apple iPhone 16e review: An A18 chip and Apple Intelligence for $599
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apple delivered its latest budget handset, the $599 iPhone 16e, without pomp. There was no big event in person, nor was there one online. No journalists scrambled through hoards of colleagues to snap photos of the phone. Instead, CEO Tim Cook tweeted out that new hardware was on the way, days before Apple announced the […]

item.title: Europe’s Relay pulls in $35M Series A after applying Asia’s model to delivery
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Being somewhat later than Europe in adopting the idea of parcel delivery, much of Asia built its delivery infrastructure around e-commerce, effectively “Uberizing” how deliveries worked down to the last mile. Think DoorDash but for parcels, not food. This is what the founders of Europe’s Relay realized and decided to bring to the region — […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Lonestar and Phison’s data center infrastructure is headed to the moon
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Data storage and resilience company Lonestar and semiconductor and storage company Phison launched a data center infrastructure on a SpaceX rocket on Wednesday that’s headed to the moon. The companies are sending Phison’s Pascari storage — solid state drives (SSDs) built for data centers — packed with Lonestar’s clients’ data on a SpaceX Falcon 9 […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Commercetools, a pioneer in ‘headless commerce’, lays off dozens of staff
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Commercetools — a “headless commerce” platform that provides APIs to companies building online storefronts — saw a major boost in its business just a few years ago, raising money at a whopping $1.9 billion valuation as the world went shopping online in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, and businesses rushed to improve their e-commerce […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Shop Circle raises $60M to encircle e-commerce with an app suite
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
The boom in e-commerce post-pandemic meant shops moved online. However, some merchants ended up with dozens of separate app providers to accommodate everything from supply chains, to inventory, to marketing. The founders of Shop Circle realized this and either built or bought many such apps. The company has now raised $60 million in a Series […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang shrugs off DeepSeek as sales soar
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is more bullish about Nvidia's sales than ever, despite a market panic last month induced by China's DeepSeek.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta’s Oversight Board is reviewing the company’s new hate speech policies
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Meta’s Oversight Board, the company’s independent group created to help with sensitive policy decisions, is preparing to weigh in on CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s recent changes to how Facebook, Instagram, and Threads handle hate speech, Engadget reported. Zuckerberg announced an overhaul of its content moderation policies in January, shortly before the inauguration of U.S. President Donald […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: With Alexa+, Amazon makes an intriguing play in the consumer agent space
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Amazon shared an impressive vision of an “agentic” future on Wednesday — one in which the company’s improved Alexa, Alexa+, handles countless mundane tasks, from booking restaurants to finding appliance repairmen. If Amazon can deliver, it could be the first out to the gate with a comprehensive, consumer-focused agent tool. The company hopes to marry […]

item.title: Trump signs executive order to expand DOGE’s spending review powers
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In a newly issued executive order (EO), the Trump administration has instructed the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), the Elon Musk-advised initiative to reduce federal spending, to create a “centralized technological system” in every agency to record contract and grant awards. As part of the ramp-up of these systems, agency employees who approved individual contract […]

item.title: a16z hires former Republican congressman Patrick McHenry as advisor
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
Former North Carolina congressman Patrick McHenry announced Wednesday that he landed a job with VC firm Andreessen Horowitz. He will be a senior advisor. His post on X said little about what the job entails, except to be advocating for startups (which a16z likes to call “little tech”) with policymakers. Andreessen Horowitz did not immediately […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Maternity clinic Millie nabs $12M Series A from an all-star, all female class of VCs
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Millie, a California-based maternity clinic, founded by Anu Sharma, announced the raise of a $12 million Series A by investors including RH Capital, TMV, and Melinda French Gates’ Pivotal Ventures.  Sharma was inspired to launch the company after the birth of her daughter in 2019. She faced pregnancy complications and, as the child of a […]

item.title: Avride’s sidewalk delivery bots land in Japan
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Avride sidewalk bots will start delivering restaurant orders and groceries in central Tokyo this week through a partnership with e-commerce giant Rakuten, the latest commercial expansion by the Yandex spinout into Northeast Asia. The Austin-based autonomous vehicle startup is one of four projects under Nebius Group, a Netherlands-based company formerly called Yandex NV that sold […]

item.title: These alternatives to popular apps can help reclaim your online life from billionaires and surveillance
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
Not every app or service wants to monetize your personal data. Here are some of our favorite alternatives to popular apps.

item.title: Here are all the tech companies rolling back DEI or still committed to it — so far
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Companies around America have started cutting DEI programs and eliminating DEI commitments from public documents in response to legal and political threats from the Trump administration. Just a few weeks ago, Attorney General Pam Bondi instructed the Department of Justice to “investigate, eliminate, and penalize,” DEI programs deemed illegal in private sector companies that receive […]

item.title: Inception emerges from stealth with a new type of AI model
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Inception, a new Palo Alto-based company started by Stanford computer science professor Stefano Ermon, claims to have developed a novel AI model based on “diffusion” technology. Inception calls it a diffusion-based large language model, or a “DLM” for short. The generative AI models receiving the most attention now can be broadly divided into two types: […]

item.title: Hacked crypto exchange Bybit offers $140M bounty to trace stolen funds
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Bybit has already paid more than $4 million to bounty hunters who helped trace and freeze some of the stolen funds.
